title: Nathan Mantel
summary: Nathan Mantel (February 16, 1919 – May 25, 2002)[1] was an American biostatistician best known for his work with William Haenszel which led to the Mantel–Haenszel test and its associated estimate, the Mantel–Haenszel odds ratio. The Mantel–Haenszel procedure and its extensions allow data from several sources or groups to be combined while avoiding confounding.[2]
